The timeout is because you're trying to feed the function mem_span_finset.mp something which it can't eat but which it's desperately trying to digest. It wants a term of type x âˆˆ Submodule.span R â†‘s and Ideal.span is the same as Submodule.span R but the issue is the little arrow on the s. Lean is trying to unify the set (â‹ƒ s âˆˆ fs1, â‹ƒ t âˆˆ fs2, {s * t}) with â†‘s for some s : Finset R and the up-arrow the coercion to a set. But you have given it a set which wasn't coerced from a finset. It's a shame it times out rather than just saying "that's not a set coerced from a finset" but I think that's the issue.

    simp only [U1_open, compl, ğ•, Set.mem_setOf_eq, not_forall, Classical.not_imp, U2_open]
    exists I1 * I2

    rintro âŸ¨âŸ¨f1, âŸ¨f1_in_I1, P_notin_V1âŸ©âŸ©, âŸ¨f2, âŸ¨f2_in_I2, P_notin_V2âŸ©âŸ©âŸ©

      or_self, not_false_eq_true, and_self]

    rcases IsNoetherian.noetherian I1 with âŸ¨fs1, fs1_spanâŸ©
    rcases IsNoetherian.noetherian I2 with âŸ¨fs2, fs2_spanâŸ©
    simp only [â† fs1_span, Ideal.submodule_span_eq, â† fs2_span] at f_in_I1I2

    -- new code here
